alert.note: Alert for Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 12:27AM CDT until May 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Tulsa. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1225 AM CDT, Emergency management reported flooded roadways in southern Tulsa due to heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Bixby... Jenks... Glenpool... Catoosa... Jenks Riverside Airport... Liberty... Leonard... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
